com.github.dandelion.core.asset.locator

Class AbstractAssetLocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dandelion.core.asset.locator.AbstractAssetLocator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AssetLocator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ApiLocator, ClasspathLocator, JarLocator, RemoteLocator, WebappLocator, WebjarLocator

    public abstract class AbstractAssetLocator
extends Object
implements AssetLocator

    Abstract base class for all AssetLocator.

    By default, all AssetLocator are active and caching of assets is not forced. It's up to the implementation to adapt this behaviour.

    Since:
    0.10.0
    Author:
    Thibault Duchateau

      • isCachingForced

        public boolean isCachingForced()
        Specified by:
        isCachingForced in interface AssetLocator
        Returns:
        true if the asset has to be cached in order to be accessed by the DandelionServlet, otherwise false if it can be directly accessed.

      • getLocation

        public String getLocation(AssetStorageUnit asu,
                 javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)

        Checks that the asset if properly configured before computing its location.

        Specified by:
        getLocation in interface AssetLocator
        Parameters:
        AssetStorageUnit - The asset storage unit from which the location should be extracted.
        request - The current HTTP request.
        Returns:
        the customized location
        Throws:
        DandelionException - if the location associated with the selected location key is null or empty.

      • getContent

        public String getContent(Asset asset,
                javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)

        Returns the content of the given Asset, using its Asset.getFinalLocation() value.

        Note that this method can be used to access the asset's content after the AssetProcessor's execution.

        Specified by:
        getContent in interface AssetLocator
        Parameters:
        asset - The asset from which the content should be extracted.
        request - The current HTTP request.
        Returns:
        the raw content (unprocessed) of the passed Asset.
